@graph.caption: Festive Vegan Falafel with Cranberry Pear Dip

@graph.name: Festive Vegan Falafel with Cranberry Pear Dip - Vegan Heaven
@graph.description: These festive vegan falafel with cranberry pear dip make the perfect appetizer for Christmas! Healthy, super easy to make, and so delicious!

@graph.headline: Festive Vegan Falafel with Cranberry Pear Dip
@graph.keywords: chickpea balls,chickpea walnut balls,cranberry pear dip,easy falafel,falafal,falafel with canned chickpeas,falafel with cranberry dip,falafel with dip,festive vegan appetizer,how to make falafel,pan-fried falafel,vegan appetizer,vegan appetizers for Christmas,vegan Christmas recipes,vegan dips,vegan falafel,vegan holiday meal ideas,vegan holiday recipes,walnut balls,walnut falafel

@graph.name: Festive Vegan Falafel with Cranberry Pear Dip
recipeIngredient: 1 handfull fresh parsley ((blended together with the chickpeas))
1/2 cup fresh parsley, chopped ((added later on))
2 tablespoons spelt or whole wheat flour
2 tablespoons brown sugar or coconut sugar

recipeInstructions.text: Put the chickpeas together with the garlic, the cumin, cilantro, and one handful of fresh parsley in a food processor and blend until you got a smooth mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the chickpeas together with the garlic, the cumin, cilantro, and one handful of fresh parsley in a food processor and blend until you got a smooth mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Put it in a bowl and stir in the chopped parsley, the walnuts, and the flour and season it with salt and black pepper. Stir with a wooden spoon until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Put it in a bowl and stir in the chopped parsley, the walnuts, and the flour and season it with salt and black pepper. Stir with a wooden spoon until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Form about 15 balls and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Form about 15 balls and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Then make the cranberry pear dip. Put all ingredients into a small sauce pan and cook for about 15 minutes. The sauce is supposed to thicken to a jam-like consistency. Once it's ready, pour it into a blender and process until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Then make the cranberry pear dip. Put all ingredients into a small sauce pan and cook for about 15 minutes. The sauce is supposed to thicken to a jam-like consistency. Once it's ready, pour it into a blender and process until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: While the cranberry sauce is cooking, heat some olive oil in a large frying pan. Make sure to use enough oil, so the falafel get crispy on the outside. Pan-fry them for about 5 minutes, flipping them over several times.
recipeInstructions.name: While the cranberry sauce is cooking, heat some olive oil in a large frying pan. Make sure to use enough oil, so the falafel get crispy on the outside. Pan-fry them for about 5 minutes, flipping them over several times.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the falafel together with the cranberry dip.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve the falafel together with the cranberry dip.
